name: prehistorically
content:
prehistorically adverb
(BEFORE WRITTEN HISTORY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves or relates to the period before there were written records : The area contains some of the most prehistorically significant archaeological sites in Latin America. Archaeologists have often discussed the problem of how to keep track of what happened prehistorically.

prehistorically adverb
(OLD-FASHIONED)
disapproving in a way that is very old-fashioned : That era now seems almost prehistorically peculiar. This point of view is both completely ridiculous and prehistorically misogynistic.
More examplesFewer examplesYou can call me extremely, prehistorically, old-fashioned, but I just prefer the way nature traditionally works.
